text.p: These are the leading stories in the Tunisian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Ben Ali recommends to have the country's students aware of the Tunisian Army's capacities in research, innovation and training.
- All tax-free shops at Tunisia's six airports to be run by a Swiss firm.

- Tunisia has 965 post offices, averaging one office for 9,200 inhabitants. It has 1.1 million telephone lines, with an average of 6.8 lines per 100 inhabitants compared with three lines per 100 inhabitants before 1987.
